almanac 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Find holidays

Source: R/holidays.R
holidays_all.Rd

These functions help with locating all holidays for a specific calendar. They locate both pre-existing and manually added holidays.

  • holidays_all() lists every holiday in cal from the minimum date (1901-01-01) to the maximum date (2199-12-30).

  • holidays_all_calendars() maps holidays_all() over all calendars available in calendars, and returns a data frame.

  • holidays_between() locates holidays betwen two dates.

holidays_all(cal, weekends = FALSE)

holidays_all_calendars(weekends = FALSE)

holidays_between(start, stop, weekends = FALSE, cal = calendar())

Arguments

cal

[calendar]

A calendar.
weekends

[logical(1)]

Should weekends be treated as holidays?
start, stop

[Date(1)]

Boundary values to look for holidays between. Both are inclusive boundaries. It is required that start is strictly less than stop.

Value

  • holidays_all() returns a vector of Dates.

  • holidays_all_calendars() returns a data frame with a character "calendar" column, and a list_of<date> "holidays" column. If the tibble package is installed, a tibble will be returned.

  • holidays_between() returns a vector of Dates.

Examples

us_holidays <- holidays_all(calendar())

length(us_holidays)
#> [1] 2838
us_holidays[1:5]
#> [1] "1901-01-01" "1901-02-22" "1901-05-30" "1901-07-04" "1901-09-02"

holidays_all_calendars()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 2
#>   calendar                     holidays
#>   <chr>                    <list<date>>
#> 1 argentina                     [2,947]
#> 2 argentina_merval              [2,947]
#> 3 united_states                 [2,838]
#> 4 united_states_settlement      [2,838]

# Locate holidays between two dates
cal <- calendar()

holidays_between("2019-01-01", "2019-03-01", cal = cal)
#> [1] "2019-01-01" "2019-01-21" "2019-02-18"

# Manually added holidays are respected
cal <- holidays_add(cal, "2019-01-02")
holidays_between("2019-01-01", "2019-03-01", cal = cal)
#> [1] "2019-01-01" "2019-01-02" "2019-01-21" "2019-02-18"

# So are manually removed holidays
cal <- holidays_remove(cal, "2019-01-01")
holidays_between("2019-01-01", "2019-03-01", cal = cal)
#> [1] "2019-01-02" "2019-01-21" "2019-02-18"
